instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115B: What is 820-3115B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
hi..i have a macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps...when i check the board 
there is 

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]=<SIGNAL>PPVTT_S0_DDR_LDO</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
missing this voltage ..then i check the enable signal...

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]=<SIGNAL>DDRVTT_EN</SIGNAL>[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
this enable also missing

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message: another intresting thing is ..this board sometime working...also display is coming..that time this voltage also active..

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
All the other voltages present, when te board is stuck?
Post the VCORE voltage after 10s.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
now the board takes only 0.340milli amps...in this condition  VCORE voltage is zero
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> also 0

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
Apart of CPU, do you get voltage on other big coils?
Check <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
ys...get voltages on all big coils...cpu coil volages missing
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> get 3.3v

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/03.
Also check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
If all good, try known good BIOS.

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> shows 150 k
<RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> shows 182 k
SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces are ok(showing correct value)
also try 2 bios...still same

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 19, 29, 46, 47.
Do you note any drop pulse at 1 & 48?

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
pins 19:-5 v
pin 29:- 5v
pin 46 :- 5v
pin 47 :- 3.3v
<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> gets 0.60v
<RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> gets 0.49 v(ic side)

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message: also i change core ic.....still same

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ...<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>..taking 0.300 milli amps
threads.message:
No voltage at all at L7510/20?
Looks like CPU power supply is running...
